intro: Cousinia haeckeliae, commonly known as the Haeckel's cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, aiding in water retention, while its flowers are small and yellowish, often arranged in clusters. Cousinia haeckeliae is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
